newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean President Kim urges financial reform.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean President Kim urges financial reform.

text.p: South Korean President Kim Young-sam on Monday urged implementation of the financial reforms proposed by a president panel.

"Financial reform is a requisite for us to become an advanced country in the 21st century and an urgent task, which cannot be delayed, to prevent financial scandals," Kim said in a meeting with the Presidential Commission for Financial Reform and Finance Minister Kang Kyong-shik.

The commission recommended an 18-point draft of short-term changes to the nation's financial system. The proposals included expanding business lines open to financial institutions and permitting representatives of the top five conglomerates to sit on bank boards as non-permanent board members.
The 31-member commission was set up in January after Kim said he would push forward with reforming the financial sector. The panel consisted of bankers, business leaders and scholars.
Kim said financial reforms should be consumer-oriented and should strategically position Korea for the 21st century.

Kim told the finance minister to make every every effort to implement the reforms, including enacting necessary laws. He also urged the commission to come up with mid- and long-term plans for further reform.
